headline: News quiz: Test your knowledge of this week in Berkeley news
subhead: Did you follow the news in Berkeley this week, Feb. 11-16? To take our quiz, choose an answer, and the correct response will appear after you click.

sections.question: Since Feb. 5, the only immigration attorney for UC Berkeley’s Undocumented Student Program, or USP, has been on paid administrative leave. Why was Prerna Lal placed on leave?
sections.articleTitle: The jury’s out on why Undocumented Student Program’s only lawyer is still on paid administrative leave
sections.explanation:
According to Lal, their boss said USP requested that Lal be placed on administrative leave at the East Bay Community Law Center — which the campus contracts for immigration legal services — because some students allegedly complained about Lal. 

But campus spokesperson Janet Gilmore said that it is “absolutely untrue” that USP requested that Lal be placed on administrative leave.

sections.question: Berkeley City Council recently lowered the city’s recreational marijuana tax. What percentage did it drop to?
sections.articleTitle: Berkeley lowers recreational cannabis tax from 10 to 5 percent
sections.explanation: City officials lowered the city’s recreational tax amid criticism from business owners and stakeholders that customers were experiencing “sticker shock.”

sections.question: This week, the Berkeley Forum hosted an speaker event on the subject of fear and religion. Who was their speaker?
sections.option1: Robert Baer, a former CIA agent
sections.option2: Vinton Cerf, chief internet evangelist at Google
sections.option3: Rachel Vogelstein, director at the Council on Foreign Relations
sections.option4: Peter Goettler, president and CEO of the Cato Institute
sections.articleTitle: Former CIA agent discusses fear and religion at Berkeley Forum event
sections.explanation: Author and former CIA agent Robert Baer discussed the politics of faith and fear, talking about how societies such as Lebanon and Iraq have transitioned from secularism to religious fanaticism.

sections.question: Berkeley high schoolers recently launched a GoFundMe campaign to provide care packages to whom?
sections.articleTitle: Berkeley high schoolers fundraising to give care packages to homeless
sections.explanation: A Berkeley High School club launched the campaign in January to raise $1,000 for “B.I.O.N.I.C Boxes” (which stands for Believe It Or Not I Care). The boxes will include water, snacks for the day and hygiene products such as sanitary wipes and tampons.

sections.question: A UC Berkeley alumnus is suing an airline company for racial discrimination after he was removed from a flight in 2016 after speaking Arabic before takeoff. Which airline is he suing?
sections.articleTitle: UC Berkeley alumnus removed from Southwest flight after speaking Arabic files suit
sections.explanation: Khairuldeen Makhzoomi is seeking compensatory and punitive damages against Southwest Airlines for the alleged violation of his civil rights and for the emotional distress caused during the April 2016 incident.
